problem_text:
Conjecture: Let G be a hyperbolic group. Then every 2-dimensional rational homology class is virtually represented by a sum of closed surface subgroups, that is, for any α ∈ H2(G; Q) there are finitely many closed oriented surfaces Si and injective homomorphisms ρi : π1(Si) → G such that ∑i[Si] = nα, where [Si] denotes the image of the fundamental class of Si in H2(G).
D. Calegari
